posts.post_content:
"Well [Sangromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sangromancer), looks like we're on the same side this time."  
  
"Yep."  
  
"Thing is, I still don't quite trust you yet."  
  
"Oh, no, you can totally trust me, we'll team up and beat those Phyrexians all right."  
  
"...Okay, let's go." \*turns back\*  
  
"Haha psyche I'm going to yoink all your blood anyway."

Posted By: dberry02 (3/11/2011 12:11:23 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Okay... When I first saw this I thought that it was for-all-effects-and-purposes strictly better than [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade). And, at least in a lot of causal circles, it is. More people run black than run artifacts, so go nuts. But I also feel like I should caution those who are eating this up all too eagerly. It simply *isn't* strictly better than [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) in constructed. In fact, catching your opponent off guard by running [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) instead is probably a better plan. [Wurmcoil Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wurmcoil Engine) is being run more heavily because of this card. Punish the decks that are playing around this removal spell with unpredictability.
posts.html:
Okay... When I first saw this I thought that it was for-all-effects-and-purposes strictly better than Doom Blade. And, at least in a lot of causal circles, it is. More people run black than run artifacts, so go nuts. But I also feel like I should caution those who are eating this up all too eagerly. It simply isn't strictly better than Doom Blade in constructed. In fact, catching your opponent off guard by running Doom Blade instead is probably a better plan. Wurmcoil Engine is being run more heavily because of this card. Punish the decks that are playing around this removal spell with unpredictability.

Posted By: Enemy_Tricolor (2/28/2011 2:26:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Fools, only the most powerful magic can destroy Emrakul. That or [Ersatz Gnomes](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ersatz Gnomes).
  
   
Though it is very likely that Emrakul will be an illegal target as the spell is being cast, rather than when the spell resolves. So you may have to work around it by targeting an [Inktreader Nephilim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inktreader Nephilim), and then making GTFO colorless. (this ofcourse turns GTFO into a 2 cmc [Damnation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Damnation))
posts.html:
Fools, only the most powerful magic can destroy Emrakul. That or Ersatz Gnomes.

Though it is very likely that Emrakul will be an illegal target as the spell is being cast, rather than when the spell resolves. So you may have to work around it by targeting an Inktreader Nephilim, and then making GTFO colorless. (this ofcourse turns GTFO into a 2 cmc Damnation)
